item.title: My SQL Server Toolbox
item.description: I get asked a lot about the tools I use at Stack Overflow to monitor and work with our SQL Servers. I figured it might be helpful to others to make the list public. I’ll also do my best to keep it updated as things change. The current list of both free and 3rd party paid tools is below: Free Tools Opserver - Stack Exchange’s Monitoring System - I pretty much live in our instances of Opserver because it gives me a one-stop shop to see the health of all of our SQL Servers
